glsa.title: tnftp: Arbitrary file overwriting
glsa.synopsis: tnftp fails to validate filenames when downloading files, making it vulnerable to arbitrary file overwriting.

background.p: tnftp is a NetBSD FTP client with several advanced features.

description.p: The 'mget' function in cmds.c lacks validation of the filenames that are supplied by the server.

impact.p: An attacker running an FTP server could supply clients with malicious filenames, potentially allowing the overwriting of arbitrary files with the permission of the connected user.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
